text: Mamadou Doumbia (born 3 December 1980) is an Ivorian former professional footballer who played as a defender. ==Career== Born in Abidjan, Doumbia began his career with Académie de Sol Beni and was promoted to ASEC Mimosas in winter 1999–2000. In July 2006 he signed for FC Istres while a transfer fee of €350,000 was paid to ASEC Mimosas. After a six-year stint with Istres, he moved to Ligue 2 rivals Le Mans on 22 June 2011. ==External links== * * Category:Living people Category:1980 births Category:Sportspeople from Abidjan Category:Ivorian footballers Category:Ivory Coast international footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:FC Istres players Category:ASEC Mimosas players Category:Al-Arabi SC (Kuwait) players Category:Le Mans FC players Category:CA Bastia players Category:Championnat National players Category:Ligue 2 players Category:Ivorian expatriate footballers Category:Ivorian expatriate sportspeople in France Category:Ivorian expatriate sportspeople in Kuwait Category:Expatriate footballers in France Category:Expatriate footballers in Kuwait
title: Mamadou Doumbia
